column5: The MSc in Biomedical Engineering at Keele is a multidisciplinary course that will prepare you for an exciting career across a wide range of areas of engineering in medicine, be that in academic or industrial research, the medical devices sector or in the clinical arena. The course is professionally accredited and suitable for people with both engineering and life science backgrounds, including medicine and subjects allied to
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: Full-time - 12 months Part - time study will allow you to complete it over two years
